title: Mick Cleary's verdict on England's 23 heroes from Rugby World Cup 2019 win over New Zealand
text:
England needed the perfect performance to get past the All Blacks on Saturday - and they very much delivered.

Here our rugby union correspondent Mick Cleary gives his verdict on each of the 23 players involved. You can give your own verdict in the comments section below.

15 - Elliot Daly

The full-back’s early slippery run set the tone for the evening, Daly breaking free and striking deep into New Zealand territory. Versatile, too, as shown when switching to wing for injured Jonny May. 8/10

14 - Anthony Watson

The Bath wing causes defences all sorts of problems with his twitchy feet and strong hips, making yardage and staying upright through the tackle long enough for his support to get...
description: England needed the perfect performance to get past the All Blacks on Saturday - and they very much delivered.
